Kai Li is a US citizen arrested in China since September 2016 on politically motivated charges of espionage and stealing state secrets. He is currently the **only** American detained in China for "endangering national security." 

On July 25, 2018, nearly two years after his initial detention, Kai was sentenced to 10 years in prison, a 50,000 RMB fine, and deportation. He is alleged to have stolen state secrets and conducted espionage on behalf of the FBI, even though such "secrets" are freely searchable on the Internet according to Kai's defense attorney.

Kai has been held at the Qingpu Prison in Shanghai since March 2019. He sleeps in an unheated cell with a dozen inmates, and a mysterious note hidden in a Christmas card bought by a six-year-old girl in the UK unearthed [forced labor conditions and torture](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/dec/28/tesco-christmas-card-china-jail-inmates-claim-psychological-torture) in the foreign prisoners' unit where Kai is held. 

While Kai is granted two 7.5-minute phone calls per month to his family, they are closely monitored by prison authorities. After expressing a desire for President Trump to intervene in his case in one such call, Kai was threatened with punishment, including restrictions on funds needed to buy essentials at the prison commissary. As consular and family visits have been suspended since January 2020 due to the COVID-19 outbreak, Kai's mental and physical condition are very much uncertain.

This website is designed to raise awareness of Kai's situation with the hope of allowing him to return home as soon as possible. You can help by sharing this website on social media and writing to your elected officials. 

A timeline of developments in Kai's case can be found [here](/Timeline/). For media inquiries, please e-mail freekaili2016@gmail.com.
